\phantomsection\label{index:module-rampedpyrox.core.thermogram}\index{rampedpyrox.core.thermogram (module)}\phantomsection\label{index:module-thermogram}\index{thermogram (module)}\index{Thermogram (class in rampedpyrox.core.thermogram)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{index:rampedpyrox.core.thermogram.Thermogram}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxstrong{class }\sphinxcode{rampedpyrox.core.thermogram.}\sphinxbfcode{Thermogram}}{\emph{t}, \emph{Tau}, \emph{g}}{}
Base class for thermogram objects.

\begin{notice}{note}{Note:}
This class is intended for subclassing and should never be called directly
\end{notice}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{RealData (class in rampedpyrox)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{index:rampedpyrox.RealData}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxstrong{class }\sphinxcode{rampedpyrox.}\sphinxbfcode{RealData}}{\emph{all\_data}, \emph{nT=250}}{}
Subclass for real data thermograms (i.e. actual dirt burner data).
\index{plot() (rampedpyrox.RealData method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{index:rampedpyrox.RealData.plot}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{plot}}{\emph{ax=None}, \emph{xaxis='time'}}{}
Plots the true thermogram and peaks against time or temp.
\begin{description}
\item[{Kwargs:}] \leavevmode
ax (plt axis handle): Axis to plot on or None
xaxis (str): Sets the x axis units: either `time' or `temp'

\item[{Returns:}] \leavevmode
ax (plt axis handle): Updated axis with plotted data

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\index{ModeledData (class in rampedpyrox)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{index:rampedpyrox.ModeledData}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxstrong{class }\sphinxcode{rampedpyrox.}\sphinxbfcode{ModeledData}}{\emph{t}, \emph{Tau}, \emph{g\_hat}, \emph{gp}}{}
Subclass for thermograms generated using an f(Ea) distribution.
\index{plot() (rampedpyrox.ModeledData method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{index:rampedpyrox.ModeledData.plot}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{plot}}{\emph{ax=None}, \emph{xaxis='time'}}{}
Plots the modeled thermogram and peaks against time or temp.
\begin{description}
\item[{Kwargs:}] \leavevmode
ax (plt axis handle): Axis to plot on or None
xaxis (str): Sets the x axis units: either `time' or `temp'

\item[{Returns:}] \leavevmode
ax (plt axis handle): Updated axis with plotted data

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}
